moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O
comment: This position can be reached from many move orders, including 1.d4 d5 2.c4 e6 3.Nf3 c6 4.g3 f5 5.Bg2 Nf6 6. 0-0 Bd6 7.Nbd2.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7
comment: Black usually plays ...Nbd7, to prevent White from occupying e5 with a knght.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5
comment:
White needs to occuly the e5 square at some point, since otherwise Black will
eventually play ...e5. As long as White maintains control of e5, Black will
find it difficult to activate the light-squared bishop.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3
comment: This is a standard anti-Dutch plan. The knight at e5 is supported by both a pawn at d4 and another knight at either f3 or d3.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4
comment:
Black can safely keep the knight here if an enemy knight is at f3, so that
White cannot place a pawn there. In many cases the knight can sit at e4 even if
the f3-square is not occupied, since the weakening of the a7-g1 diagonal can
prove embarassing for White if the f-pawn advances. In addition, g3 can become vulnerable.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4
comment: White invites Black to advance the g-pawn. This is a double-edged strategy.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5
comment: !? Black accepts the challenge.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6
comment: White now owns a superior bishop, but Black has plenty of room to maneuver.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8
comment:
There are two ways to activate the light-squared bishop in the Stonewall Dutch.
Black can fianchetto it at b7 under some circumstances, msot easily when the
knight sits at b8 to defend the pawn at c6. The other plan, seen here, is to redeploy it on the kingside.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1
comment: White takes care to get the king off the a7-g1 diagonal in case Black opens up the game with ...c5.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5
comment: Although Black has a bad bishop, there is little to fear in most of the possible endgames.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6
comment: White must now take seriously the threat of advancing the f-pawn.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7
comment: Black prepares to operate on the h-file.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1
comment: White gets the king off the dangerous h-file.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4
comment: White does not want to allow ...f4, even as a sacrifice.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4 Rh7 28. b5 hxg3 29. hxg3 Qh5 30. Qf2
comment: ? This square is needed for the king.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4 Rh7 28. b5 hxg3 29. hxg3 Qh5 30. Qf2 Qh2+ 31. Kf1 Rhh8
comment:
It looks as though Black cannot make further progress. It is true that I have
exhausted the possibilities on the h-file, but there is another path to the
enemy king, via the queenside, and with the next very subtle move I prepare a deep and long plan

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4 Rh7 28. b5 hxg3 29. hxg3 Qh5 30. Qf2 Qh2+ 31. Kf1 Rhh8 32. bxc6
comment: Had Dmitry figured out the point of my last move, he never would have opened up the b-file.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4 Rh7 28. b5 hxg3 29. hxg3 Qh5 30. Qf2 Qh2+ 31. Kf1 Rhh8 32. bxc6 Rxc6 33. Rxc6 bxc6 34. Qe1 Rb8 35. a4 Rb3
comment: White is in completely tied down.

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Kh1 Nf7 18. cxd5 exd5 19. e3 Nxe5 20. fxe5 Bg6 21. Qd2 Kg7 22. b4 h5 23. Rf2 Rh8 24. Rcf1 h4 25. Kg1 g4 26. Rc1 Qg5 27. Rf4 Rh7 28. b5 hxg3 29. hxg3 Qh5 30. Qf2 Qh2+ 31. Kf1 Rhh8 32. bxc6 Rxc6 33. Rxc6 bxc6 34. Qe1 Rb8 35. a4 Rb3 36. Rf2
comment: Desperation. The rook should stay in its passive post at f4, as now the Black bishop enters the game. ?

moves: 1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nf3 c6 4. Nbd2 f5 5. g3 Nf6 6. Bg2 Bd6 7. O-O Qe7 8. Qc2 O-O 9. Ne5 Nbd7 10. Ndf3 Ne4 11. Bf4 g5 12. Nxd7 Bxd7 13. Bxd6 Nxd6 14. Ne5 Be8 15. f4 Bh5 16. Rac1 Rac8 17. Rxc6 bxc6 34. Qe1 Rb8 35. a4 Rb3 36. Rf2 f4
comment: The threat is ...Rb1, pinning the queen.

comment: White resigned.
